name: mri_segment_hypothalamic_subunits
description: This module segments hypothalamic subunits and can be run in two modes: on FreeSurfer subjects or on any T1-weighted scan(s) of approximately 1mm resolution.

inputs.description: (required in FS mode) Name of one or several subjects in $SUBJECTS_DIR on which to run the module, assuming recon-all has been run on the specified subjects.
inputs.name: Subjects

inputs.description: (FS mode, optional) Save posteriors; default is False.
inputs.name: Write Posteriors Flag

inputs.description: (required in T1 mode) Image(s) to segment. Can be a path to a single image or to a folder.
inputs.name: Image Input

inputs.description: (required in T1 mode) Segmentation output(s). Must be a folder if --i designates a folder.
inputs.name: Output

inputs.description: (T1 mode, optional) Posteriors output(s). Must be a folder if --i designates a folder.
inputs.name: Posteriors

inputs.description: (T1 mode, optional) Resampled image(s). Must be a folder if --i designates a folder.
inputs.name: Resample

inputs.description: (T1 mode, optional) Output CSV file with volumes for all structures and subjects.
inputs.name: Volume Output

inputs.description: (both modes, optional) Size of the central patch to analyse (must be divisible by 8). The whole image is analysed by default.
inputs.name: Crop Size

inputs.description: (both modes, optional) Number of cores to be used. Default uses 1 core.
inputs.name: Threads

inputs.description: (both modes, optional) Enforce running with CPU rather than GPU.
inputs.name: CPU Flag

output-files.description: CSV file with volumes for all structures and subjects.
output-files.name: Volume Output CSV

author: FreeSurfer Developers
